activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory Jordan

records.addlTxt:
8:59 AM Defendant Gregory Jordan in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matte scheduled as a return on warrant. 
Defendant provides an explanation for why his missed the last court appearance. Defendant wants time to go back to the SPD office to see if he now qualifies for services. 
State does not object to vacating the warrant and reinstating the bond. 
BTC: VACATE WARRANT and reinstate bond. Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Return on warrant on October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:27 AM Defendant Gregory Jordan not in court.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defendant does not appear. 
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited.
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No violent contact with the victim PL (person, property, residence or family).

2:08 PM Defendant Gregory Jordan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Gregory Jordan.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly Larsen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
